definition: to camp/to pitch camp/stationed/quartered/Taiwan pr. [zha2 ying2]
to tie/to bind/classifier for flowers, banknotes etc: bundle/Taiwan pr. [zha2]
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: We pitched on the other side of the hill.
They detach the tailer, and start to camp.
sentences.chinese: 他們卸下掛車，開始紮營。

sentences.english: On their long march, the King and his army made camp for the night wherever they could.
sentences.chinese: 在行軍途中，國王每晚都要依地紮營。

sentences.english: We should set up campu here.
People are camped outside the police station at night.
sentences.chinese: 民衆夜間在警察局外紮營守候。

sentences.english: If you encamp with us, we can go back to Songpan on the sixth day.
sentences.chinese: 如果和我們紮營，那麼第六天返回松潘。

sentences.english: They left Zalmonah and camped at Punon.
sentences.chinese: 由匝耳摩納起程，在普農紮營。

sentences.english: After encamping, we can either go to the LongSea immediatly or go there the next day.
sentences.chinese: 紮營後可以自行去看長海，也可以第二天去看。

sentences.english: The army camped in the mountain.
Camping at the bottom of the mountains, beside the sea, Lyngsalpene.
sentences.chinese: 林格斯山脈，在山腳下的海邊紮營的人。

sentences.english: They pitched a camp in the mountains .
And departing from Cades, they camped in mount Her, in the uttermost borders of the land of Edom.
sentences.chinese: 由卡德士起程，在位於厄東地邊界上的曷爾山下紮營。

sentences.english: Most are now camped out in nearby Zucotti Park.
sentences.chinese: 大多數遊行者現在都在附近的祖科迪公園紮營。

sentences.english: Liangyi made camp half-way up the peak.
After months of slow travel, they stopped to make their winter camp.
sentences.chinese: 經過幾個月慢長的行程，他們停下來紮營以便過冬。

sentences.english: And they departed from Tahath, and pitched at Tarah.
sentences.chinese: 他們從以琳起行，來到紅海岸邊，就在那裏紮營。

definition: to stop on the way for a rest
strategically situated and easy to defend/strategic location
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in

pinyin: Xi3 ma3 la1 ya3 shan1 mai4

definition: shallow sea/sea less than 200 meters deep
sheer cliffs and precipitous rock faces (idiom)
no sign of human habitation (idiom); desolate
